FuncDef:
The nqa twamp-light command creates a TWAMP Light service and displays the TWAMP Light view. If the service specified in the nqa twamp-light command has been created, the command displays the TWAMP Light view.
The undo nqa twamp-light command deletes a TWAMP Light service.
By default, no TWAMP Light service is created.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
TWAMP Light, as a light version of TWAMP, simplifies the control protocol used to establish test sessions and measures the round-trip network performance. To create a TWAMP Light service, run the nqa twamp-light command.
Precautions
After the undo nqa twamp-light command is run to delete a TWAMP Light service, the Client, Session-Sender, and all related sessions and statistics are deleted.
